DataAnalyzer.Functions package¶

Submodules¶

DataAnalyzer.Functions.func_import module¶

This modules only purpose is to import classes dynamically

DataAnalyzer.Functions.func_import.dyn_import_cls(module_name, class_name)[source]¶

This function can be used to import classes dynamically. The return can be used like any other class. The function is used to dynamically import Plot types specified in PlotTypes package.

Parameters:
  • module_name (str) – module from which to import the class
  • class_name (str) – name of the class
Returns:

class

Note

This function returns a class

DataAnalyzer.Functions.func_mat module¶

func_mat.py contains the function load and save. load loads a matlab file and outputs structs as a python dictionary and vectors as python lists. save writes the FileData object to a dictionary, which can then be written to a matlab file

DataAnalyzer.Functions.func_mat.load(filename)[source]¶

Source: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7008608/scipy-io-loadmat-nested-structures-i-e-dictionaries. This function should be called instead of direct scipy.io.loadmat as it cures the problem of not properly recovering python dictionaries from mat files. It calls the function check keys to cure all entries which are still mat-objects

Parameters:filename (str) – Name of matlab file
Returns:Dictionary of the matlab Data structure
DataAnalyzer.Functions.func_mat.save(object, file: str = None, names=['PlotData'])[source]¶

save is a recursive function which goes over the hole Data structure (cl_data) and converts it back to a dictionary.

Parameters:
  • object (object) – The object, which should be converted
  • names ([str, str, ..]) – [typically: ‘PlotData’] The names of the inner classes required for the next recursion step
  • file (str) – Default: None. If specified, save writes the dictionary to .mat file with the name specified in file
Returns:

a dictionary
